titleInfo.title: Letter no. 1583 of 1822 from Secretary of Government of Bombay to Lieutenant John MacLeod, Resident in the Persian Gulph [Gulf]

mods.abstract: Informs MacLeod that the Agency in Turkish Arabia has been separated from that in Persia and Captain [Robert] Taylor has been appointed to the former. The letter also mentions an increase in salaries for the Native Agents at Bushire and Muscat to two hundred rupees per mensem.A letter (1582 of 1822, dated 12 November 1822) from the Secretary of the Government of Bombay to Lieutenant-Colonel B Kennett informing him that his political functions will cease on the arrival of Lieutenant MacLeod at Bassidore and all appointments dependent on the occupation of the island of Kishm will be terminated from the date of the evacuation from the island. In addition, Kennett is advised to give to MacLeod the official records of his Agency.
